I would say yes. 

Here's why. Many things the Catholic Church does are traditional. They do the same things for a long time. It is good to respect tradition. But it is also important to be open to change.

Some Catholics think they have to go to church every week. They are strict about how things are done. Sometimes, the Catholic Church judges people who do not follow the rules exactly. They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. They also do not accept people of other religions.

For example, my mom was an Episcopalian and my dad was also an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. But they could not marry in the Catholic Church because of my dad's religion.

This is not being tolerant of other religions. We are taught to love others, which is a Catholic teaching. But it is not fair to say to love others and then not accept them.

I think some parts of Catholic teaching tell you what to do. But the way the Church acts is not always like this. It is too old-fashioned. But the Church still follows it.

I do not think this would make a difference. I think it would be a good idea to allow priests to marry. But I do not think this would stop them from behaving badly with children. It is a different situation.

People who do bad things with children will probably do it anyway. It is not about being married or not. So, I do not think allowing priests to be married would help.

I am not sure about this issue. I have not thought about it deeply. I do not think either side is right or wrong. But I know this is a very difficult topic. It is hard because the separation of church and state and the definition of marriage are closely connected.

I think a civil union is a good idea. It means that two people are together. They should not have to tell the government about their church or God. The government should only care about the fact that they are together.

I also think about same-sex marriage. If two people love each other, they should be able to get a civil union. It does not matter if they are gay or not.

If all the states can come to an agreement, they should make it a federal law. But changing the constitution to ban gay marriage is not a good idea. It is not important enough. We should not change the constitution for this reason.

I do not think this issue is serious enough to change the constitution. We should just leave it alone.

I grew up in a Christian family. Homosexuality is a complex issue for me. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with their lifestyle, but I think it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. Instead, each state should decide for itself.

Many states are democratic or republican. Democratic states are more likely to support gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know how that state feels about the issue. I do not think you should disagree with the state's decision if it legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there, so I think you should respect the state's decision.

I already said this, but I think homosexuals should have the same rights as heterosexuals. Each state should decide whether to allow gay marriage.

I disagree with President Bush's ban on gay marriage. He cannot decide how every state should be. He lives in one state, but he is not in charge of all states. He will be out of office soon. If a democratic president is elected, they may lift the ban. It would just go back and forth. Each state should decide for itself. They will have to live with the decision, not the president.

No, I do not think we should have a national law requiring all states to allow gay marriage. Each state should be free to make its own decision.

I don't think it's a problem for the school officials to see a student's Myspace page.  Myspace is a public place where people can post things for others to see. If you post something there, it's like saying it out loud in a public place.  School officials can see it, but it's not an invasion of privacy.

If they go on the internet to look for student behavior, that's to make the school a safer place. They might look for things like drinking or smoking. But I think it's okay if they do this to save lives. It's like a responsibility of the school to keep students safe.

Schools can see what students are doing, even if it's not on the school's website. They can see it from home. So, it's not like an invasion of privacy. If they save lives or make the school a better place, I think it's okay.

Many schools have rules and do things to keep students safe. They practice lock downs and drills in case of emergencies, like terrorist attacks. This is like what the school officials did in this case. They wanted to prevent something bad from happening, like a school shooting.

I think it's not a problem for school officials to see a student's Myspace page. They can see it if they want to. It's not an invasion of privacy. They are trying to make the school a safer place.

I have mixed feelings about the war. At first, I supported it because I was affected by the 9/11 attack. I wanted to do something to help. But I think we did not think about the long-term effects. We went to war without a clear plan. I believe this led to problems for us. I now oppose the war. I do not think it helped. As long as the people in that country fight with each other, they cannot fight with us. I do not think our presence there helped.

I stopped caring about the situation there because of the 9/11 attack. I do not think they are human. They fight with each other and cannot work together. I do not care what happens to them.

We went to war without being prepared. We did not know what to expect. War is different for them than for us. They are savage in war. I do not think they want to improve their country. I think they want us to leave. We should leave.

We went to war for revenge. I do not think we thought about the consequences. President Bush wanted to go to war. Many people wanted to go to war because of 9/11. I understand why he made the decision. But I think we could have had a better plan.

We did not have a clear goal. We did not know what to do to create order. There was no unity among the people in charge. I think this made things worse. We created problems in that country because of our emotions. I do not think we can change the people there. I think they will always be the same.

I do not think we are making progress. We made some progress, but it is not enough. I think the country will collapse when we leave. We cannot stay there forever. I think we are hurting ourselves by staying in that country.
